author: rimeissner
content:
Question regarding EOF<>legacy contract compatibility (please point me to another channel if there is one for such topics):

Is it possible to use a proxy written in the legacy format (i.e. [UUPS](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1822) or a [minimal proxy](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1167)) where it points to an EOF contract for the implementation logic? 

Asking in the context of [EIP-7701](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7701) to understand if users could upgrade existing accounts that use proxies or if they would have to migrate their assets.

author: rimeissner
content: Ahhh ... as always writing a message and then finding the answer ðŸ˜“ . It is mentioned in the [EOF EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3540#changes-to-execution-semantics): `We allow legacy to EOF [delegatecall] path for existing proxy contracts to be able to use EOF upgrades.`

author: _shemnon
content: Short answer: yes.  For any more drill down ask your Q's in <#706868829900505180>
